Author: Adli#5025
Content: Hi guys üòÉ I was just working on a scrapper and I see that the 2 komodo explorer give different results : https://www.kmdexplorer.io/ between https://explorer.komodo.services/

Author: Adli#5025
Content: It is quite weird

Author: Adli#5025
Content: You can check random adress like : https://www.kmdexplorer.io/address/RPjUmFNcWEW9Bu275kPxzRXyWDz6bfQpPD or https://explorer.komodo.services/address/RPjUmFNcWEW9Bu275kPxzRXyWDz6bfQpPD

Author: Adli#5025
Content: Have you already know it @metaphilibert

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content:
Hmmm as far as I can see quickly from my phone it is not a "random" address, seems it is a Notary one üòÅ
With many many tx
Insight explorer is not accurate for such addresses as I think it has a limited number of indexed tx by address or something like that

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: I know it is horrible to not be able to rely on a block explorer

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content:
For "normal" addresses (with a "normal" numbers of tx) the 2 explorers should give you same results
You can also check https://kmdexplorer.ru/

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: Not sure about the number of tx needed for the explorer becoming inaccurate. (think I remember something like 10k but not sure at all)

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content:
Or maybe it is due to reorgs...
ü§î if you reindex or resync a block explorer, these hugely used addresses are displayed with good infos. But after a few days the difference with reality is already growing.
Maybe the explorer should wait a delay of a few blocks (5? 10?) before to get the data
Less practical cause you have to wait 10 blocks to see your freshly done tx displayed on the explorer, but should be more accurate...

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: @Decker @CHMEX as you guys are used to the insight explorer what do think about it?

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: The issue is limited to Notary addresses (or equivalent in term of usage) but still can lead to errors if you rely on the explorer's api for example

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
@metaphilibert 
kmd.explorer.dexstats.info/address/RPjUmFNcWEW9Bu275kPxzRXyWDz6bfQpPD
dexstats.info/richlistlookup.php?address=RPjUmFNcWEW9Bu275kPxzRXyWDz6bfQpPD

looks to me the komodo.services explorer is out of sync.
the richlistlookup comes directly from getsnapshot

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: @Adli use getsnapshot no need to scrap from the explorers

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: and here you have a snapshot which updates each 15 minutes https://www.dexstats.info/snapshots/KMD_snapshot.json   in cae you don't want to run your own node

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content:
oh a snapshot for t-addresses, nice üòç 
wasnt aware about that, thanks @CHMEX

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content:
for general discussion about explorer, even if komodo.services is out of sync (doesnt seems to), there is huge difference between https://www.kmdexplorer.io/address/RPjUmFNcWEW9Bu275kPxzRXyWDz6bfQpPD and https://kmdexplorer.ru/address/RPjUmFNcWEW9Bu275kPxzRXyWDz6bfQpPD
it is a known issue since mid 2017, and i was wondering how to tune the sync of an explorer to have it reflect the reality, even with those hugely used addresses
i was runnning several iquidus before the built-in insight era, and the problem was already there
not komodo related, it should happen on every blockchain

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: *on every blockchain with crazy projects like komodo that creates many tx (like, hem,  in a real world mass adoption :trollface: )

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: sorry quite under emotion about this because it makes me remember the horrible moment when i realized an explorer was not always a reflection of the reality of a blockchain üò±

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: roooo so happy to discover this getsnapshot function, it will make me sleep better

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
it is funny that some explorers are out of sync I guess having different nodes running and comparing would be a good idea making. I think reindexing takes a while.
Also something to mention is that getsnapshot does not show coins send to the burnaddress as they are untouchable

Author: CHMEX#0686
Content: and there is also coinsupply ( hit it in steps till you reach the current height I suggest 100k steps) which shows you the current supply or coinsupply HEIGHT for a current height same here burnaddress excluded

Author: metaphilibert#0926
Content: also, thanks @dukeleto for this function üôè

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: hello everyone, I'm seeking some assistance in adding coins to Barterdex. anyone have a guide for Addis Bitzec

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Adding Bitzec in Barterdex  through Github?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @Subie117

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/barterDEX/get-listed-barterDEX.html?highlight=barterdex

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Here is some documentation for doing this ...

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: @Hermes there was a forum response I came across stating i would need to run the BitZec node along with BarterDex. Any insight on how to do that?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If the Bitzec node is configured to save the userdata in the default folder that is used inside %appdata%  with it's .conf set up properly it should work...you will need to have the node fully synced and run the native mode in Barterdex ...also here is a guide on how to manage your coins in Barterdex when you want to add them for the first time  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zVziQQvjb-I&t=104s

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: @Hermes appreciate all the help, thank you

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: how long until coins deposit onto BarterDex? It's been almost 12hrs and dont see a deposit. I sent 3 small transactions with no luck

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: @Subie117 are you on native or electrum mode ?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: and also mention on which os you are on ?

Author: gmr#4027
Content: i have passport that has validity expired is this acceptable for id verification on trading sites?

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: @Nabob native mode and on Win10

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
Check for your conf settings, it has these details
```server=1
rpcuser=xxxxx
rpcpassword=xxxx```

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: @Nabob is it located under the Roaming folder? If cant locate it.

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: Yes, `%appdata%\Roaming\Bitzec\bitzec.conf`

Author: luke#8628
Content: Is  this the most up to date Komodo documentation? https://docs.komodoplatform.com/index.html

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: Yes, Luke, This is our developer documentation  link

Author: Subie117#6527
Content: @Nabob ah okay yeah I know where that file is. I mistakenly thought you were talking about the barterdex conf file. But going to edit my conf file to what you sent

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: yeah, just add those params and restart you daemon. Seems coin developer not using those params

Author: flhctroll#7452
Content: hey all. i am using agama for my pirate wallet. it shows deposits, but not any withdrawals. i would like to keep track of them being sent to the exchange. any ideas why it doesn't show withdrawals?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You  can see the opids in the Send tab while your Pirate node is online  but the past transactions that you did in the previous sessions of the node won't be recorderd in the transactions tab. You can also see them in the CLI by using z_listoperationids @flhctroll

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Trying to update to the new komodod using the manual install method.

I've made sure to update my computer and everything, and I've made sure to check that all the libraries are installed.

I'm getting this error when I try to run the `make` command:

```
checking whether htobe32 is declared... yes
checking whether htobe64 is declared... yes
checking whether bswap_16 is declared... yes
checking whether bswap_32 is declared... yes
checking whether bswap_64 is declared... yes
checking for MSG_NOSIGNAL... yes
checking for visibility attribute... yes
checking for Berkeley DB C++ headers... no
configure: error: libdb_cxx headers missing, Bitcoin Core requires this library for wallet functionality (--disable-wallet to disable wallet functionality)
Makefile:556: recipe for target 'config.status' failed
make[1]: *** [config.status] Error 1
make[1]: Leaving directory '/home/siddhartha/komodo'
Makefile:1649: recipe for target '../config.status' failed
make: *** [../config.status] Error 2
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
There's discussion about this here.

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/2998

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
I tried both 

`sudo apt-get install libdb++-dev`

and this

```

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:bitcoin/bitcoin
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install libdb4.8-dev libdb4.8++-dev
```

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content: no luck so far

Author: Bryan_Beus#6442
Content:
Trying to install on a separate laptop. 

At `./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)`, I'm getting this error:

```
Makefile:659: recipe for target 'all-recursive' failed
make: *** [all-recursive] Error 1
```

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: `git clean -f`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: `./zcutil/build.sh -j8`

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: call those over an over

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: until it builds

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: usually 1 or 2 is enough
